intro: Brassica kaber var. schkuhriana, commonly known as the white mustard, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are encased in a hard, triangular capsule, which is characteristic of the mustard family. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive weed in agricultural settings.
